error.signature: Task timed out after X.XX seconds (Lambda timeout)

verdict.summary: Lambda function exceeded its timeout. Default is 3 seconds, max 15 minutes.

dead_ends.action: Set timeout to 15 minutes for everything
dead_ends.why_fails: Long timeouts waste money and may indicate a performance issue

workarounds.action: Increase timeout in function config to match expected execution time
Check what's slow: cold start, DB connections, external API calls
workarounds.how: Enable AWS X-Ray tracing to identify the slow segment: aws lambda update-function-configuration --function-name X --tracing-config Mode=Active. Check CloudWatch Logs for duration breakdown.

workarounds.action: Use provisioned concurrency to eliminate cold start delays

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Lambda timeout means the entire function exceeded its configured execution time limit (default 3s, max 15min); RDS connection timeout means the database connection specifically failed or timed out, which may or may not cause a Lambda timeout
'Task timed out after X.XX seconds (Lambda timeout)' indicates a network or operation timeout, while 'service unable to place tasks' indicates ECS unable to place tasks on instances.
